intro: Nortenia, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Chile and Argentina. The plants are evergreen shrubs characterized by their dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. Nortenia species typically thrive in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to grow in challenging, high-altitude conditions.
